title: Amigo forced to beg for breathing space after breach of market rules
text:
Woodford-backed guarantor loans business Amigo announced late on Friday that it has been forced to beg for breathing space after the number of company shares in public hands fell below a required threshold.

The company, which loans money to customers with bad credit scores if repayments are guaranteed by a friend or relative, said that the proportion of its stock which is free to trade on the market had dropped below a 25pc minimum limit.

The so-called free float now stands at only 21.2pc, forcing Amigo to go cap in hand to the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA).
